name: SDOHCC_CodeSystem_TemporaryCodes
title: SDOHCC CodeSystem Temporary Codes
description: A local code system defined within the context of the SDOH-ClinicalCare IG.
purpose: The purpose of this code system is to enable temporary codes to be assigned to concepts that are needed to document SDOH-related data elements defined by the Gravity Project community and concepts that are needed to facilitate the use of FHIR to exchange data as required in the use cases covered by this IG.  After the IG has been sufficiently tested through HL7 Connectathons and the coded concepts have been confirmed as fit for the intended purpose, and consensus on the use of the codes has been confirmed through the HL7 Ballot process, the temporary codes will be replaced with coded concepts established within nationally recognized, open code systems.  The replacement of temporary codes with permanent codes is intended to happen prior to the IG being published by HL7.

concept.definition: Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Food Insecurity (which is defined as: Uncertain, limited, or unstable access to food that is: adequate in quantity and in nutritional quality; culturally acceptable; safe and acquired in socially acceptable ways.) The Food Insecurity Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Food Security.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Housing Instability and Homelessness (which are respectively defined as defined as: 1) Currently consistently housed, but experiencing any of the following circumstances in the past 12 months: being behind on rent or mortgage, multiple moves, homelessness; and 2) currently living in a shelter, motel, temporary or transitional living situation, scattered site housing, or not having a consistent place to sleep at night; or lacking a fixed, regular, and adequate nighttime residence.) The Housing Instability and Homelessness Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like  Housing Stability.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Inadequate Housing (which is defined as: Housing with moderate to severe physical problems.) The Inadequate Housing Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Housing Adequate.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Transportation Insecurity (which is defined as: A condition in which one is unable to regularly move from place to place in a safe and timely manner because one lacks the material, economic or social resources necessary for transportation.) The Transportation Insecurity Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Transportation Security.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Financial Strain (which is defined as: Financial resource strain encompasses both the subjective sense of strain as the result of economic difficulties and specific sources of strain.) The Financial Strain Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Financial Security.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Social Isolation (which is defined as: An objective lack of social contact with others.) The Social Isolation Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Adequate Social Interaction.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Stress (which is defined as: A subjective state that arises when an individual recognizes a situation as threatening, but dealing with the threat requires more resources than the individual has available.) The Stress Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Feeling Relaxed.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Interpersonal Violence (which is defined as: Violence between individuals, subdivided into family and intimate partner violence and community violence.) The Interpersonal Violence Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Domestic Violence.

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Education (which is defined as: The knowledge and skills gained through education, the credentialing linked to the completion of various levels of schooling, and the quality of education.)

Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to the domain of Employment(which is defined as: Working in a job or occupation, and the type and conditions of employment.) The Employment Domain is a spectrum which may also include entites like Unemployed and Retired.

concept.display: SDOH Risk Related to Veteran Status
concept.definition: Category for Social Determinant of Health artifacts that pertain to SDOH Risks Related to Veteran Status (which is defined as: Military service in the armed forces of the United States or other nations, including the length and branch of service, the military occupation, the location and type of duty (e.g., in the United States or abroad with combat, combat support, or noncombat duties), and any ongoing illness, injury, limitation, or disability that began during military service.)
Code used for Task.output.type to represent the activity/action that is the result of a fulfilled task.
